title: Hero police take turns reviving baby who was choking on cracker in bodycam video

A one-year-old baby was saved from choking on a cracker by a group of patrolling police officers.

Mum Amanda Zimmerman called for help when she noticed her 18-month-old son MJ stopped breathing after choking on a cracker.

A Florida police officer happened to drive past at the moment and he quickly ran to her aid and put little MJ on his back and started performing a CPR on the tot.

The dramatic moment was captured on the policeman's bodycam as he pressed onto the baby's chest.

Amanda told local TV station WESH : "At that point, I was just beside myself."

(Image: Kissimmee Police Department)

As officer Miguel Lanzo and his colleagues are reviving little MJ, they can be heard yelling: "Come on baby, come on!"

Five officers takes turn giving back thrusts and clearing the baby's airway.

Seconds later, the baby let out a gasp.

He was then rushed to a hospital and according to Amanda, the doctors said MJ was going to be just fine.

She said: "Being without oxygen for that long and then just coming out, you know, he didn't miss a beat.

(Image: Kissimmee Police Department)

(Image: Kissimmee Police Department)

"God put them [the police] where they needed to be and it was just amazing they were coming down at that very moment."

She also thanked the officers for the heroic save and says she plans to take a CPR class.

Amanda decided to give her baby a new nickname - Miracle Michael - and plans to tell him the story some day later.

Five Kissimmee police officers were reunited with the baby today and said it was 'a combination of training and good luck' that helped save MJ.

(Image: Kissimmee Police Department)

Officer Lanzo said he noticed the mother running out of her home and calling for help.

He told the TV station : "Try to save the boy. That was the only thing that was going through my mind was try to save the boy.

"Especially seeing him in that condition. Just wanted to save his life, that's all."
description: WARNING: DISTRESSING CONTENT Five police officers in Florida performed CPR to clear a baby's airway after realising he stopped breathing
